channel.title: How do i make items go into the correct spots when equiped?
channel.description: *SORRY IF THIS IS IN THE WRONG SECTION!* I've added many customs to my client. But i dont know how to make them go into the right slot. Help please?

item.title: How do i make items go into the correct spots when equiped?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“iz3 legend, post:6, topic:391392”]If you dont know the sources its easy to specify them

Pi’s have Everything organazied in folders when you open up and

Deltas is kinda a mess, most of its files are just there when you open it like not really organaized

a pi would have like
Bin - Folder
com - folder
data - folder
deps folder -
src folder -

A delta would just have them all there like
all
on
one
page
like
this
no
folders
besides
cfg[/quote]PI’s don’t have com unless you have mysql involved I think.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i make items go into the correct spots when equiped?
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

If it is Delta, open up the item class file. Inside, you should see something like

public static int amulets[] = {4035,6577, 10519, 10413, 11204, 11205, 1120611146, 11147, 11148, 11149, 11150, 11151, 11152, 11141, 6857, 6859, 6861, 6863, 1724, 1718, 6585, 86, 774, 87, 295, 421, 552, 589, 1478, 1692, 1694, 1696, 1698, 1700, 1702, 1704, 1706, 1708, 1710, 1712, 1725, 1727, 1729, 1731, 4021, 4081, 4250, 4677, 6040, 6041, 6208, 11274, 11275, 11276, 11273, 11941 };
Find the appropriate section for your item, add the ID to it, compile, run.

Read full topic

item.source: How do i make items go into the correct spots when equiped?

item.title: How do i make items go into the correct spots when equiped?
item.dc:creator: @iz3_legend iz3 legend
item.description:
@iz3_legend wrote:

This is the easiest way, post your custom item in item.java then say its a platebody you would copy rune platebody and paste at the end then make it your item id and then change the stats, but it will go to the correct place then. so it might look like this
item = Youritemid Youritemname Youritemdescription. 0 0 0 0 0 0 -21 -7 51 49 47 -4 49 0 0 then you can change its stats to make it fit your custom. This will have it going to the right place

Read full topic

item.title: How do i make items go into the correct spots when equiped?

@iCreatedHorror wrote:

What base: PI, delta, etc.
Some bases are different in which files you edit to fix this.
And also, search bar.
